intro: Coreopsis macraei, commonly known as the showy coreopsis, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It features bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with toothed edges. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies adds ecological value to its habitat.
